org.smartfrog.services.www
Interface JavaWebApplicationServer

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
All Known Subinterfaces:
DeployByCopyServer
All Known Implementing Classes:
DeployByCopyServerImpl
public interface JavaWebApplicationServer
extends java.rmi.Remote

A webapp server is something that knows how to deploy web applications. How it does so is up to it. created 23-Jun-2004 13:40:25

Method Detail

deployWebApplication

JavaWebApplication deployWebApplication(org.smartfrog.sfcore.prim.Prim webApplication)
                                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                               org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException
deploy a web application. Deploys a web application identified by the component passed as a parameter; a component of arbitrary type but which must have the mandatory attributes identified in JavaWebApplication; possibly even extra types required by the particular application server.

Parameters:
webApplication - the web application. this must be a component whose attributes include the mandatory set of attributes defined for a JavaWebApplication component. Application-server specific attributes (both mandatory and optional) are also permitted
Returns:
an entry referring to the application
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on network trouble
org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException - on any other problem

deployServletContext

ServletContextIntf deployServletContext(org.smartfrog.sfcore.prim.Prim servlet)
                                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                               org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException
Deploy a servlet context. This can be initiated with other things.

This should be called from sfDeploy. The servlet is not deployed

Parameters:
servlet -
Returns:
a token referring to the application
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on network trouble
org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException - on any other problem
